newsitem.title: CHINA: China propaganda boss wants more good news.
newsitem.headline: China propaganda boss wants more good news.

text.p: China's propaganda chief has called on the nation's journalists to back Communist Party policies and give priority to "positive" reporting, official media said on Friday.
Journalists should also seek greater political awareness, Ding Guangen, head of the party's propaganda department, was quoted as saying.

"Journalists should strengthen political awareness...and resolutely keep conformity with the party central committee with (Communist Party chief) Jiang Zemin at the core," Ding told a media conference.
"It is necessary to put a resolute and correct political orientation in the first place (and) firmly conduct correct guidance in public opinion," the People's Daily reported him as saying.
China's Communist rulers keep a tight grip on the media, which it views as a propaganda tool that must serve party interests.
The party held its annual plenum earlier this month and called for a return to basic socialist values that have been eroded by market-oriented reforms.
It lashed out at corruption and "money worshipping" and called for the official media to help in the campaign to stamp out these evils.
Ding called on journalists to adhere to the party's basic line and principles and to give priority to positive propaganda, the newspaper said.
"Media work should, while taking economic construction as the central task, have the overall interests of the party and the people in mind," he said.
Ding also praised the media for "having created a sound atmosphere for the promotion of socialist cultural and ethical progress".
